answers.text:
Hi Kathleen,
I went poking around the Knowledge Network’s Documents page for an answer to your question, and I came across a very thorough communications plan from the City of Reno, Nevada. (http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303904/Strategic_Communications_Plan) 
This plan outlines and justifies a robust communications program, and it gets down to the nuts and bolts of your question when it begins to discuss the “community liaison” on page 41 of the pdf file. Between the liaison and proscribed Neighborhood Advisory Boards, you could likely communicate the status of capital projects that affect specific neighborhoods. 
Aloha,
James Davidson
Knowledge Network Intern
